snippet: In a pilot program, the Police Department has distributed some smartphones to its officers, allowing them to look up suspects’ criminal histories and verify their identification.
abstract: New York City Police Department distributes smartphones to its officers in pilot program allowing them to look up suspects' criminal histories and verify identities; phone application is significantly different from computers currently installed in roughly 2,500 patrol cars, allowing access to far more detailed information and multiple databases without going through dispatcher.
lead_paragraph: In a pilot program, the Police Department has distributed some smartphones to its officers, allowing them to look up suspects’ criminal histories and verify their identification.

headline.seo: New Tool for Police Officers: Quick Access to Information
headline.main: New Tool for Police Officers: Records at Their Fingertips
